Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the severity of the incident by stating that Vishnu Goswami was set on fire, when in fact he was burned alive.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to validate the involvement of the individuals named in the incident.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the incident was motivated by religious differences without providing concrete evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or motives for the altercation and subsequent burning of Vishnu Goswami that are not mentioned in the claim.
